SiteNameAddress: Kempshott Park Industrial Estate  Longwood Copse Lane Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 57 dwellings (48 houses & 9 apartments)
Notes: The site received planning permission, subject to legal agreement, in September 2009 (BDB71030) for 63 dwellings and 2,740m2 commercial floorspace.  A new application for 57 residential units was granted in August 2014 (13/00155/FUL). 48 units were completed in 2016/17 and  Bellway have  confirmed, through the annual site monitoring process, that the remainder will be completed  in 2017/18.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Construction of 2 no. 2-bed flats & 4 no. 1-bed flats following demolition of existing 1st floor flat
Notes: Small site granted permission (13/00747/FUL) in Feburary 2014. Currently under construction.

SiteNameAddress: Main Hall Park Prewett Northbrook Crescent Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Conversion of main hall to 19 residential units and 300m2 of community space
Notes: Planning permission was granted for a net gain of 19 units in March 2015 (13/02321/FUL) . The site is under construction and the developer (Taylor Wimpey) has confirmed, through the site monitoring consultation, that the remaining units will be delivered in 2017/18.  A planning application has been submitted to provide an additional 9 units in the hall (17/00565/FUL), and this is awaiting determination.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from offices to 10 residential affordable units and office for community use
Notes: Planning permission for the conversion of this council owned building was granted in October 2014 (14/00759/FUL). Work is expected to commence in 2017-18.

SiteNameAddress: Burnham Copse Infant School New Church Road Tadley
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Redevelopment of former Burnham Copse Infant School site for up to 36 residential units (use classC3), open space and associated car parking with all matters reserved
Notes: Outline planning permission for 36 residential units was granted in March 2016 (14/02200/OUT). First completions are expected in 2019/20. It is considered that the site is deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: J A Hirst & Sons Recycling Yard  Hurstbourne Station Hurstbourne Priors
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Outline application for residential development up to 30 units and 1156sqm of commercial B1(a) offce use with access and associated works following demolition of existing buildings
Notes: Outline planning permission was granted  for 30 units on the site in February 2016  (14/02489/OUT). However, a new application (16/02664/FUL) has been submitted (August 2016) for 44 dwellings (awaiting determination). As a result of the change of approach, completions are expected in 2019/20.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Renovation and conversion of Bothy Courtyard to provide 3 no. two bed and 3 no. three bed residential dwellings and garaging courtyard
Notes: Small site granted permission (14/03190/FUL) in December 2014.  No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Daneshill Court  Daneshill Drive Lychput Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Conversion of building to form 1 no. 1-bed & 2 no. 2-bed flats and erection of 11 no. 2, 3 and 4 bed dwellings.  with associated garages and car parking spaces. Construction of new access onto Great Binfields Road following closure of existing vehicular access
Notes: Planning permission was granted  for 14 units on this site in July 2015  (14/03916/FUL ). The scheme includes 11 new build units and 3 conversions. The developer has confirmed that all 14 properties have been completed and sold since April 2017.

SiteNameAddress: Sun Alliance House 37 Wote Street Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of from class B1 to class C3 consisting of 36 flats and extension of 3rd floor with an additional 4th storey to provide a further 6 no. 1-bed flats & 8 no. 2-bed flats
Notes: A prior notification was approved for the conversion of the building to 36 flats (15/00503/GPDOFF) in April 2015. Full planning permission was granted for an extension to provide an additional 14 flats (15/01309/FUL) in May 2016.The site is under construction and site visits undertaken as part of the annual monitoring process confirmed that the development is at a very advanced stage.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Partial demolition of office building (B1a) & conversion of remainder to form 7 no. dwellings & erection of 6 no. dwelling
Notes: Planning permission was granted in May 2016 for the conversion of offices to 7 units and erection of 6 further units on site (15/00975/FUL). Site is under construction.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 2 storey building incorporating 6 no. 1-bed flats following demolition of bungalow
Notes: Small site granted permission (15/01259/FUL) in August 2015.  No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from 2 no. flats & therapy centre to 6 no. flats
Notes: Small site  granted permission in November 2015 (15/02230/FUL). Currently under construction.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change use of class B1a office and vacant class D2 to class C3 consisting of 12 no . apartments
Notes: The site gained permission via prior approval in June 2015  (15/01507/GPDOFF). for 8 flats. A further 4 units gained permission in  Jan 2017 (15/02353/FUL). It is considered that the site is deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Conversion of A1 retail unit to contain 6 x flats with associated works and internal alterations to form 2 flats on first floor
Notes: Small site granted planning permission (15/02782/FUL) in March 2016. currently under construction.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Demolition of existing buildings (Class B1a) and redevelopment of site to provide a 3 storey residential block providing 70 flats (44 no. 1-bed, 23 no. 2-bed and 3 no. 3-bed units) with associated cycle and refuse storage, parking and landscaping.
Notes: A prior notification was approved for the conversion of the building to residential use (14/02433/GPDOFF) encompassing 12 units. However,  a new application for  70 units on the site (15/03170/FUL) was granted permission in December 2016. The site has been cleared to enable development to take place imminently. Start on site recorded 2017-01-01. Completions expected from 2018/19.

OwnershipStatus: mixed ownership
DevelopmentDescription: Conversion to provide 6 no. 1-bed units involving alterations & extensions to existing building with internal alterations to the commercial units on the ground floor and throughout the upper floors
Notes: Small site  granted permission in Feburary 2016 (15/03457/FUL). Currently under construction.

SiteNameAddress: Knights Farm  Knights Lane Ball Hill Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Demolition of existing B8 buildings and erection of six dwellings. Creation of a new access, and alteration of an existing access, to Knights Lane. A land swap involving a change of use of agricultural land to residential and change of use of commercial land to agricultural. Associated landscaping
Notes: Small site granted permission (15/03590/FUL) in September 2016.  No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Land At Chapel Hill  Kingsclere Road Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of up to 578 dwellings inc conversion of white building
Notes: Outline planning permission granted for 578 units (14/00865/OUT) in January 2015. Reserved matters consent for the full 578 units  (15/03667/RES) was granted in May 2016. Work has commenced on site and the first 12 units were completed in 2016/17.  Delivery projections are based upon starts on  site (91 units under construction at April 2017 with a further 35 started April to Jun 2017. 45 units were completed by June 17). 56  of the units are to be delivered in the existing  'white building' and an application to increase this to 96 units (17/02279/FUL) is currently being considered.

SiteNameAddress: Spectrum House 8 Woodlands Business Village Coronation Road Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from offices to residential consisting of 13 flats (9 no. 2-bed & 4 no. 1-bed)
Notes: Prior notification was approved  for 13 flats on the  site in December 2015  (15/03777/GPDOFF). It is understood that the site has been sold to a developer who will implement the scheme. Completions expected from 2019/20.

SiteNameAddress: Lock Up Garage Site May Street/lower Brook Street Brookvale Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: mixed ownership
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 12 no. dwellings to provide affordable housing (4 no. 1-bed flats & 8 no. 2-bed houses) with associated parking and landscaping following demolition of existing lock-up garages
Notes: Full planning permission (15/04189/FUL) was granted  in March 2017 for 12 affordable units.  The site has been sold by the council and the new owners Sovereign have indicated that they are due to commence on site in September 2017 with completions expected in July 2018.

SiteNameAddress: Queen Marys College Land Adjacent To Cliddesden Road Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: unknown ownership
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 6 no. dwellings
Notes: Outline planning permission grated under reference BDB/74060 in July 2016. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Royal British Legion  The Street Bramley
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 9 no. dwellinghouses (4 no. 2-bed dwellings & 5 no. 4-bed dwellings) following demolition of members' club
Notes: Small site granted permission (15/04506/FUL) in November 2016. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Demolition of existing industrial units & erection of 4 no. 2-bed, 4 no. 3-bed & 2 no. 4-bed dwellings
Notes: An application (15/04534/FUL) for 10 units was granted in September 2016.  The site owner states that the site is deliverable and is due for completion in 2018/19. The site is under construction.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use  of class B1a office to class C3 (dwellinghouses) consisting of 35 no. flats
Notes: A prior notification was approved for the conversion of the building to residential use (16/00031/GPDOFF) in  March 2016 for 35 flats. The lease of the current tenants expires in autumn 2016 and the site has recently been sold. Completions are expected from 2019/20.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of B1a to C3 residential consisting of 37 flats
Notes: A prior notification was approved for the conversion of the building to residential use (14/03542/GPDOFF) for 29 units in January 2015 with a further 1 unit added through an application in January 2016 (15/03960/FUL).  An application for 7 additional units on an additional floor was granted in December 2016 (16/00971/FUL).   The development is under construction and completions are expected from 2017/18.

SiteNameAddress: Brackenwood House 1st & 2nd Floor Kimbell Road Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of class B1a to C3 comprising of 6 no. flats (2 no. 2-bed & 4 no. 1-bed)
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/01362/GPDOFF) in September 2016. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 2no. 1floor extns & 2no. External staircases to create 3no. 1 bed and 2no. 2 bed flats and restaurant with outdoor seating
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/01585/FUL) in November 2016. Currently under construction.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from restaurant to 4 no. apartments following demolition of extension & erection of 2 no. dwellings
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/02465/FUL) in November 2016.No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of 1st and 2nd floors to create 14 no. 2-bed flats and 1no. 2-bed flat at 2nd floor
Notes: Planning permission was granted in October 2013 for the conversion of the upper floors of the building to form 14 residential units (BDB/75489). A further application has since been granted for one additional flat (16/02676/FUL in September 2016). The site is under construction and is due to be completed in 2017/18.

SiteNameAddress: Mulfords Hill Centre 37-39 Mulfords Hill Tadley
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from D1 to C2 (residential institution) with external alts to the building and changes to external layout and landscaping
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/04074/FUL) in March 2017. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: The Former Lamb Inn Hackwood Road
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Demolition of existing buildings and erection of 5no. apartments with 1no. maisonette erection of 4no. semi detached dwellings associated parking turning access and landscaping
Notes: The site gained full permission for 10 units in May 2017  (16/04288/FUL). The site is currently being marketed for 10 units. The site considered to be deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Spinnaker House  Lime Tree Way Chineham Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from office to 33no. apartments
Notes: A prior approval application for conversion from office to residential was approved in February 2017 (16/04426/GPDOFF) for 33 units. A  new prior approval application  (17/02516/GPDOFF) for 36 units is currently being considered. The site considered to be deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Conversion of retail unit & offices to 3 studio flats & 2 1 bed flats with retail unit retained on ground floor fronting Winchester Street.
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/04685/FUL) in March 2017. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Former Dairy Farm  Reading Road Sherfield On Loddon
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 9 dwellings following demolition of former dairy building. creation of access from Tynley Place/Foxs Furlong
Notes: Small site granted permission (16/04693/FUL) in March 2017. No start on site has been recorded at 1 April 2017 but the site considered deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of class B1(a) office to class C3 dwellings house consisting of 38no. 1 and 2 bed flats
Notes: The site gained prior approval for 38 units in June 2017  (17/00135/GPDOFF). A further application to extend the building for 20 units (17/02933/FUL) is also currently being considered and therefore the yield may rise in due course. It has been stated through the annual site monitoring that the site is due to be delivered in 2018/19 to 2019/20.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of class B1a office to class C3 consisting of 285 flats
Notes: A prior notification was first approved for the conversion of the building to residential use (16/00504/GPDOFF) in  May 2016 for 257 flats. This was increased to 283 flats by a further prior notification in April 2017 (17/00416/GPDOFF) and  for an additional 2 (penthouse) flats also in April (17/00625/FUL).   The investor and developer (Seven Capital) has confirmed, through the site monitoring consultation, that all 285 units will be delivered by the end of 2018, although a slightly more cautious approach has been used for land supply purposes. Construction is currently ongoing.

SiteNameAddress: Land Adjacent To 96 Paddock Road Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 5 no. affordable houses consisting of 3 no. x 3 beds and 2 no. x 2 bed houses with private gardens and associated parking
Notes: Planning permission granted in July 2017 for 5 affordable units (17/01207/FUL). The site is vacant and has been cleared.  It is considered that the site is deliverable within five years.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use of class B1(a) office to class C3(dwellings house consisting of 37no. flats
Notes: The site gained prior approval for 37 units in August 2017  (17/01714/GPDOFF). The developer has stated that the development will be complete by the end of 2018. A more conservative approach has been taken for land supply purposes.

SiteNameAddress: St Pancras House Jacobs Yard Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order
DevelopmentDescription: Change of use from class B1(a) office to class C3 consisting of 20 no.flats (permitted development notification)
Notes: Prior notification was approved  for 20 flats on the  site in September 2017.  (17/02486/GPDOFF).  It is considered that the site is deliverable within five years.

SiteNameAddress: Land At Former Newman Bassett House Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Residential development of 12 units
Notes: Consent was originally granted on the site (SHLAA Ref. BAS070)  for the demolition of the Former Newman Bassett House building and a replacement smaller ‘respite unit’ has now been completed. (Hindson House).Therefore, this retains the facility and service use on the site and frees up the remainder of the land for residential redevelopment. The land is vacant and available and was promoted by HCC through the SHELAA for 12 units.  However, given the current uncertainty with timescales for progressing the site and the level of suitable development, it has been placed in the 5-10 year time band for the purposes of land supply.

SiteNameAddress: Site Of Harlech Hall Harlech Close Winklebury Basingstoke
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Residential development of 6 units
Notes: The site was promoted through the call for sites and lies within the built - up area of Basingstoke, within the SPB and within an area of predominantly residential development. the community use on the site has been unused for some time and the council, as landowner, is looking to redevelop the site in a suitable manner. any redevelopment of the site will need to provide sufficient evidence to demonstrate that due consideration has been given to the loss of the community use on the site.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Residential development of 300 units
NonHousingDevelopment: Mixed uses including office and leisure expected on wider site
Notes: The regeneration of Basing View  is being actively pursued by the borough council. This is reflected in  Local Plan policy SS8 which supports the redevelopment of the area for a mix of uses including a residential component of approximately 300 units. The site is in a suitable location for housing development, lying in a highly accessible location with good access to public transport interchanges, town centre facilities and employment opportunities. The Council has commissioned BDP (Building Design Partnership) to prepare a Basing View Masterplan which will include focused work on areas with potential for residential development. The Council is committed to its delivery for a residential led scheme, however, as only part of the site is available  now, the development has been placed outside of the 5 year timescale for the purposes of land supply.  The site plan shows the whole of basing view reflecting the local plan allocation. The location of the residential element will be determined through site masterplanning.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Residential development of 30 units
Notes: The site is a SHELAA site  which falls within the built up area of Basingstoke and within the SPB in an area of predominantly residential development in close proximity to the town. The current use as a police station is due to cease (as part of the wider review of Hampshire Constabulary sites) and is currently being marketed for redevelopment. As the site is not available now it has been placed in the 5-10 year time band.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Residential development of 12 units
Notes: This SHELAA site is owned by a Housing Association, which is being reconsidered for residential development. The council has accepted, through a previous planning application on the site, that the loss of a care facility is acceptable in planning terms. The re-use of the site for residential development is therefore established. The site meets the developability tests, as set out in the NPPF.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 205 one and two bed flats with community rooms lettable space for A1,B1,D2 use
NonHousingDevelopment: Community rooms lettable space for A1,B1,D2 use
Notes: This site has a  5 year consent for 205 units  (BDB54937). It is currently let for employment use. An extension of time application (BDB/76691) has been submitted and there is a resolution to grant subject to the legal agreement. There remains a reasonable prospect of the site being developed for residential purposes in the future, possibly as part of a more comprehensive development of Council owned land along Alencon Link. The site remains outside of the 5 year land supply as it fails to meet the deliverability tests set out in the NPPF in that the site is not available now.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 12 terraced and semi-detached dwellings
Notes: The site is the remainder of a larger scheme for tied staff accommodation at Cheam Hawtreys School  (BDB/63103, approved 2006).  The school has confirmed, through the site monitoring consultation, that whilst the site will be delivered in due course, at present they have no intention to build out the remaining 6 units within the next 5 years.  The site has therefore been phased into the 5-10 year time band and its future delivery will continue to be reviewed through the annual monitoring process.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Housing development of 10 dwellings
Notes: The site is allocated for approximately 10 dwellings in the Whitchurch Neighbourhood Plan (Policy HA3)  which was made in October 2017 . The brownfield site is currently in use as a car centre and is therefore not currently available. As such, it has been moved outside the 5 year land supply. However, the owners have confirmed their intention to redevelop the site for housings over the Plan period.

SiteNameAddress: Former Police Station Dances Lane Whitchurch
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
DevelopmentDescription: Housing development of 15 dwellings
Notes: The site is allocated for approximately 15 dwellings in the Whitchurch Neighbourhood Plan (Policy HA1)  which was made in October 2017 . The brownfield site is currently in use as a police station and is therefore not currently available. As such, it has been moved outside the 5 year land supply. The Police Commissioners have confirmed that this site will cease to be used for its present purpose and will be available for housing development within the Plan Period.
